### match() {#a23cdde8b9bdd40fd4a93d3635ca77dc6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Pattern::MatchResult Pattern::match (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Buffer, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sourcemgr">SourceMgr</a> &amp; SM) const</>}>
Matches the pattern string against the input buffer <code>Buffer</code>.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
either (1) an error resulting in no match or (2) a match possibly with an error encountered while processing the match.
</SectionUser>

The GlobalVariableTable <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filecheckpatterncontext">FileCheckPatternContext</a> class instance provides the current values of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filecheck">FileCheck</a> string variables and is updated if this match defines new values. Likewise, the GlobalNumericVariableTable <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> in the same class provides the current values of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filecheck">FileCheck</a> numeric variables and is updated if this match defines new numeric values.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h/#l00708">708</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp/#l01077">1077</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp">FileCheck.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### parsePattern() {#ae173fad50624dec05877e86be7b7e429}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Pattern::parsePattern (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> PatternStr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Prefix, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sourcemgr">SourceMgr</a> &amp; SM, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/filecheckrequest">FileCheckRequest</a> &amp; Req)</>}>
Parses the pattern in <code>PatternStr</code> and initializes this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pattern">Pattern</a> instance accordingly.

<code>Prefix</code> provides which prefix is being matched, <code>Req</code> describes the global options that influence the parsing such as whitespace canonicalization, <code>SM</code> provides the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sourcemgr">SourceMgr</a> used for error reports. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true in case of an error, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h/#l00683">683</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp/#l00764">764</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp">FileCheck.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### printFuzzyMatch() {#a3331028c9eef66f4022ac3efa310af7d}

### Substitutions {#aff56304525c840e6174b955002dfac1f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt;Substitution &#42;&gt; llvm::Pattern::Substitutions</>}>
Entries in this vector represent a substitution of a string variable or an expression in the RegExStr regex at match time.

For example, in the case of a CHECK directive with the pattern &quot;foo&#91;&#91;bar&#93;&#93;baz&#91;&#91;#N+1&#93;&#93;&quot;, RegExStr will contain &quot;foobaz&quot; and we&#39;ll get two entries in this vector that tells us to insert the value of string variable &quot;bar&quot; at offset 3 and the value of expression &quot;N+1&quot; at offset 6.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h/#l00582">582</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### VariableDefs {#a8dc704521498407c55d187400bcfba6e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::map&lt;StringRef, unsigned&gt; llvm::Pattern::VariableDefs</>}>
Maps names of string variables defined in a pattern to the number of their parenthesis group in RegExStr capturing their last definition.

E.g. for the pattern &quot;foo&#91;&#91;bar:.&#42;&#93;&#93;baz(&#91;&#91;bar&#93;&#93;&#91;&#91;QUUX&#93;&#93;&#91;&#91;bar:.&#42;&#93;&#93;)&quot;, RegExStr will be &quot;foo(.&#42;)baz(\\1&lt;quux value&gt;(.&#42;))&quot; where &lt;quux value&gt; is the value captured for QUUX on the earlier line where it was defined, and VariableDefs will map &quot;bar&quot; to the third parenthesis group which captures the second definition of &quot;bar&quot;.

Note: uses std::map rather than <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> to be able to get the key when iterating over values.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h/#l00595">595</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

Parses <code>Expr</code> for a numeric substitution block at line <code>LineNumber</code>, or before input is parsed if <code>LineNumber</code> is None.

Parameter <code>IsLegacyLineExpr</code> indicates whether <code>Expr</code> should be a legacy @LINE expression and <code>Context</code> points to the class instance holding the live string and numeric variables. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
a pointer to the class instance representing the expression whose value must be substitued, or an error holding a diagnostic against <code>SM</code> if parsing fails. If substitution was successful, sets <code>DefinedNumericVariable</code> to point to the class representing the numeric variable defined in this numeric substitution block, or std::nullopt if this block does not define any variable.

### parseParenExpr() {#a17f6d1ca14d1012b74a1a0a6f87d8ab1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; ExpressionAST &gt; &gt; Pattern::parseParenExpr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &amp; Expr, std::optional&lt; size&#95;t &gt; LineNumber, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filecheckpatterncontext">FileCheckPatternContext</a> &#42; Context, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sourcemgr">SourceMgr</a> &amp; SM)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Parses a parenthesized expression inside <code>Expr</code> at line <code>LineNumber</code>, or before input is parsed if <code>LineNumber</code> is None.

<code>Expr</code> must start with a &#39;(&#39;. Accepts both literal values and numeric variables. Parameter <code>Context</code> points to the class instance holding the live string and numeric variables. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
the class representing that operand in the AST of the expression or an error holding a diagnostic against <code>SM</code> otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h/#l00795">795</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheckimpl-h">FileCheckImpl.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp/#l00464">464</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/filecheck/filecheck-cpp">FileCheck.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
